      • createControlledErrorDialog

        public void createControlledErrorDialog(@NotNull
                                        ErrorCodes errorCode)
        Creates an ErrorDialog corresponding to the given errorCode and a default ErrorController to control this dialog.

        Caution: calling this method will block the running thread until the generated dialog is closed. The belonging controller which is created here will not be added to the overall controller list due to the view is destructed after this method.

        Parameters:
        errorCode - Error which the dialog should show

      • createControlledErrorDialog

        public void createControlledErrorDialog(@NotNull
                                        ErrorCodes errorCode,
                                        @Nullable
                                        java.lang.String[] placeholderInText)
        Creates an IErrorDialog corresponding to the given errorCode and a default ErrorController to control this dialog. The placeholder in the dialog text are replaced by elements of the given string array.

        Caution: calling this method will block the running thread until the generated dialog is closed. The belonging controller which is created here will not be added to the overall controller list due to the view is destructed after this method.

        Parameters:
        errorCode - Error which the dialog should show
        placeholderInText - Strings with which the placeholder in the dialog text should be replaced (see ITextFacade.getDialogText(String, String[]))
        See Also:
        IErrorDialog, ITextFacade.getDialogText(String, String[])

      • createControlledErrorDialog

        public void createControlledErrorDialog(@NotNull
                                        ErrorCodes errorCode,
                                        @NotNull
                                        ErrorController controllerForErrorDialog)
        Creates an IErrorDialog corresponding to the given errorCode. To this dialog the given ErrorController will be set as the controller. The controller will also be added to the list of all controllers in the system.

        Caution: calling this method will block the running thread until the generated dialog is closed. The belonging controller which is given as parameter will not be added to the overall controller list due to the view is destructed after this method.

        Parameters:
        errorCode - Error which the dialog should show
        controllerForErrorDialog - Controller which will control the dialog
        See Also:
        IErrorDialog

      • createControlledErrorDialog

        public void createControlledErrorDialog(@NotNull
                                        ErrorCodes errorCode,
                                        @Nullable
                                        java.lang.String[] placeholderInText,
                                        @NotNull
                                        ErrorController controllerForErrorDialog)
        Creates an IErrorDialog corresponding to the given errorCode. To this dialog the given ErrorController will be set as the controller. The controller will also be added to the list of all controllers in the system. The placeholder in the dialog text are replaced by elements of the given string array.

        Caution: calling this method will block the running thread until the generated dialog is closed. The belonging controller which is given as parameter will not be added to the overall controller list due to the view is destructed after this method.

        Parameters:
        errorCode - Error which the dialog should show
        placeholderInText - Strings with which the placeholder in the dialog text should be replaced (see ITextFacade.getDialogText(String, String[]))
        controllerForErrorDialog - Controller which will control the dialog
        See Also:
        IErrorDialog, ITextFacade.getDialogText(String, String[])

      • removeController

        public void removeController(BasicController controllerToBeRemoved)
        Removes the given controller from the list of all controller. Should be done if controller is not used anymore.
        Parameters:
        controllerToBeRemoved - Controller which should be removed from the list
